Files

minijinja/value/
string_interning.rs

1/// Utility module to help with string interning.
2use crate::utils::OnDrop;
3
4use std::cell::{Cell, RefCell};
5use std::collections::HashSet;
6use std::sync::Arc;
7
8thread_local! {
9    static STRING_KEY_CACHE: RefCell<HashSet<Arc<str>>> = Default::default();
10    static USE_STRING_KEY_CACHE: Cell<bool> = const { Cell::new(false) };
11}
12
13pub(crate) fn use_string_cache() -> impl Drop {
14    let was_enabled = USE_STRING_KEY_CACHE.with(|flag| {
15        let was_enabled = flag.get();
16        flag.set(true);
17        was_enabled
18    });
19    OnDrop::new(move || {
20        if !was_enabled {
21            USE_STRING_KEY_CACHE.with(|flag| flag.set(false));
22            STRING_KEY_CACHE.with(|cache| cache.borrow_mut().clear());
23        }
24    })
25}
26
27#[inline(always)]
28pub(crate) fn try_intern(s: &str) -> Arc<str> {
29    // strings longer than 16 bytes are never interned or if we're at
30    // depth 0.  (serialization code outside of internal serialization)
31    // not checking for depth can cause a memory leak.
32    if s.len() > 16 || !USE_STRING_KEY_CACHE.with(|flag| flag.get()) {
33        return Arc::from(s);
34    }
35
36    STRING_KEY_CACHE.with(|cache| {
37        let mut set = cache.borrow_mut();
38        match set.get(s) {
39            Some(stored) => stored.clone(),
40            None => {
41                let rv: Arc<str> = Arc::from(s.to_string());
42                set.insert(rv.clone());
43                rv
44            }
45        }
46    })
47}
